messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/1/2002 4:18:34 AM, kellitraas@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/1/2002 4:18:34 AM, kellitraas@... writes:

<< I guess I have never read up on NFP, but I thought that I would be safe
right after my period and that was when I got pregnant. >>

Some people are fertile when they're still menstruating depending on the
length of your period and your cycle. Kimme

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/31/02 3:42:50 PM Central Standard Time, ... I m the poster child here.  Mine are 12 months and 1 week apart. And I wouldn t have it any
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/31/02 3:42:50 PM Central Standard Time,
mikeebb@... writes:

> To go along with weird coincidences, we used to think she couldn't
> get pregnant during breastfeeding. But that happened to us (her)
> twice, so our three are all 19 months apart.
>
I'm the poster child here. Mine are 12 months and 1 week apart.

And I wouldn't have it any other way. Mark always says that Julia arrived
earlier than anticipated...

Elizabeth

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: I guess I have never read up on NFP, but I thought that I would be safe right after my period and that was when I got pregnant. Kelli squeaksoup@aol.com wrote:
messages.messageBody:
I guess I have never read up on NFP, but I thought that I would be safe right after my period and that was when I got pregnant.
Kelli
squeaksoup@... wrote:
In a message dated 10/31/2002 10:05:35 PM, kellitraas@... writes:

<< My three were also conceived when it was supposed to be 'safe'. Could
never figure that out, there wasn't supposed to be an egg at that time!
My mom was the same way, I think we ovulate early, then hence we also
didn't carry our babies 9 months either! >>

Of course if you were using NFP, you would know you'd ovulated early. NFP is
very effective if used correctly. Avoiding intercourse around day 14 in a 28
day cycle is not very effective at all. Kimme

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: ... never figure that out,  there wasn t supposed to be an egg at that time! ... didn t carry our babies 9 months either!  That s what the doctors thought
messages.messageBody:
>
> My three were also conceived when it was supposed to be 'safe'. Could
never figure that out, there wasn't supposed to be an egg at that time!
> My mom was the same way, I think we ovulate early, then hence we also
didn't carry our babies 9 months either! That's what the doctors thought
anyway!

Calendar method doesn't work. That's one reason Catholic families tend to
be big. I conceived Heather when my period was due in 3 days. And I had
always been bang on regular. That was
back when I didn't know about temps or cervical mucus. Oh well, she's
always known she was the best mistake I ever made.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: ... We ve been using it since my periods came back after Lars was born.  He s 15, and I m near the end (I hope) of perimenopause. Tia (another cervical mucus
messages.messageBody:
> There is more than a calendar to natural family planning now -
> and probably always has been among folks in tune with their
> bodies. After a few months of using NFP, you will find which of
> the multiple indicators of fertility are easiest for you to keep
> up with. My daughter-in-law swears by basal temperature; I am
> more of a cervix and mucus kind of girl (especially with peri
> menopause beginning to rear its head); my mother was blessed with
> reliable mittelschmertz, which gave her a fool proof half of the
> month.

We've been using it since my periods came back after Lars was born. He's
15, and I'm near the end (I hope) of perimenopause.
Tia (another cervical mucus kind of gal)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/31/2002 10:05:35 PM, kellitraas@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/31/2002 10:05:35 PM, kellitraas@... writes:

<< My three were also conceived when it was supposed to be 'safe'. Could
never figure that out, there wasn't supposed to be an egg at that time!
My mom was the same way, I think we ovulate early, then hence we also
didn't carry our babies 9 months either! >>

Of course if you were using NFP, you would know you'd ovulated early. NFP is
very effective if used correctly. Avoiding intercourse around day 14 in a 28
day cycle is not very effective at all. Kimme

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: My three were also conceived when it was supposed to be safe .  Could never figure that out,  there wasn t supposed to be an egg at that time! My mom was the
messages.messageBody:
My three were also conceived when it was supposed to be 'safe'. Could never figure that out, there wasn't supposed to be an egg at that time!
My mom was the same way, I think we ovulate early, then hence we also didn't carry our babies 9 months either! That's what the doctors thought anyway!
kelli
starsuncloud@... wrote:In a message dated 10/31/02 2:33:16 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< 2. If the woman is regular, you can use natural family planning until
the woman reaches the age of menopause. >>

We have two children due to this method.
It worked great for three years, every single time. But every third year, I
get pregnant at a time of the month when I should NOT be able to.
Weird?
Every time a child turns three, the very month, I get pregnant.
So there is something weird about my body. And all of my children are three
years and nine months apart.

Ren

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: There is more than a calendar to natural family planning now - and probably always has been among folks in tune with their bodies.  After a few months of using
messages.messageBody:
There is more than a calendar to natural family planning now -
and probably always has been among folks in tune with their
bodies. After a few months of using NFP, you will find which of
the multiple indicators of fertility are easiest for you to keep
up with. My daughter-in-law swears by basal temperature; I am
more of a cervix and mucus kind of girl (especially with peri
menopause beginning to rear its head); my mother was blessed with
reliable mittelschmertz, which gave her a fool proof half of the
month.

...and ya know, we each are pretty happy with the number of kids
we have - though my mother lost a number to miscarriage, and my
D-i-L isn't done by any stretch of the imagination.
----- Original Message -----
From: <starsuncloud@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2002 3:11 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed


| In a message dated 10/31/02 2:33:16 PM Central Standard Time,
| Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
|
| << 2. If the woman is regular, you can use natural family
planning until
| the woman reaches the age of menopause. >>
|
| We have two children due to this method.
| It worked great for three years, every single time. But every
third year, I
| get pregnant at a time of the month when I should NOT be able
to.
| Weird?
| Every time a child turns three, the very month, I get pregnant.
| So there is something weird about my body. And all of my
children are three
| years and nine months apart.
|
| Ren
|

messages.subject: Re: getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: ...  ... To go along with weird coincidences, we
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., starsuncloud@c... wrote:
> In a message dated 10/31/02 2:33:16 PM Central Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@y... writes:
>
<<If the woman is regular, you can use natural family planning until
the woman reaches the age of menopause. >>
>
> We have two children due to this method. It worked great for three
>years, every single time. But every third year, I get pregnant at a
>time of the month when I should NOT be able to. Weird? Every time a
>child turns three, the very month, I get pregnant. So there is
>something weird about my body. And all of my children are three
>years and nine months apart.

To go along with weird coincidences, we used to think she couldn't
get pregnant during breastfeeding. But that happened to us (her)
twice, so our three are all 19 months apart.

Mike
A believer in the theme of the book "A Full Quiver"

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/31/2002 4:07:28 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... My dh got fixed about 6 months after our 3yo dd was born. I think he was in such a hurry
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/31/2002 4:07:28 PM Eastern Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:


> I think dh would only have another child with someone if we all died....and
> even then I don't think he would even though he's just 38.
> But you never know.
>

My dh got "fixed" about 6 months after our 3yo dd was born. I think he was in
such a hurry because he figured I would probably try to talk him into having
one more baby and that I wouldn't consider getting myself "fixed." I had been
advised by our doctor not to have more babies so I reluctantly agreed with
his decision. Now that our dd is 3, my dh has even remarked that it might
have been nice to have one more.
Amy Kagey

Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< 2. If the woman is regular, you can use natural family planning until
the woman reaches the age of menopause. >>

We have two children due to this method.
It worked great for three years, every single time. But every third year, I
get pregnant at a time of the month when I should NOT be able to.
Weird?
Every time a child turns three, the very month, I get pregnant.
So there is something weird about my body. And all of my children are three
years and nine months apart.

Ren

messages.subject: getting fixed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/31/02 2:33:16 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/31/02 2:33:16 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< If I were to remarry now or in the future (like if Keith died today), I'm
49
years old. I have no business being a 70-year-old mother of a 20 year old.
>>

That was part of my decision making process too.
Although I don't believe my dh will ever want to have more childrern, he
wasn't wanting to commit to that. He just doesn't want any more with ME!! Lol
I, on the other hand, am very sure that no matter what happens in life,
including losing him, I don't ever want to have another baby.
So that did weigh into the decision.
I think dh would only have another child with someone if we all died....and
even then I don't think he would even though he's just 38.
But you never know.

Ren
